title: Nesting components
body:
Hello,
I wanted to add two another components under one so I did something like

```
React.createClass({
    InsideComponent: React.createClass({ ... })
});
```

And used it like this:

```
<this.InsideComponent />
```

Which didn't work and required me to use React.createFactory (message `Something is calling a React component directly. ...`). So I tried something like:

```
React.createClass({
    InsideComponent: React.createFactory(React.createClass({ ... }))
});
```

Which works fine, however, when I wanted to add children like this:

```
<this.InsideComponent>
    <child_a />
    <child_b />
</this.InsideComponent>
```

And reference them using `this.props.children` it didn't work. I got message `Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {}). ...` logged in console they looked like this:

![children](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12086263/13463683/be87da34-e08d-11e5-8129-99cb107d5141.png)

So I went through react code and find `autobind`. I set it to false and now everything works correctly, however I guess, there will be problems with that approach in future, because I belive autobinding is useful or, will be useful somewhere else in my outer component.

Is it bug or am I doing something wrong?
Thank you
